intro: Bonnaya ciliata, commonly known as the slender bonnaya, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a slightly hairy surface. Bonnaya ciliata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive blooms and relatively easy care requirements.
